poem:
Title: "In Shadows of Brit Gangster Flicks"

Brick tumbles in cool Britannia,
Splinters kaleidoscope on the silver screen.
The dodgy geezer navigates -
Through the cloth tapestry of drugs, 
Capers etched in neon.
In ludicrous delight, each scene echoes -
A risible dance of working class bravado,
Little we know, beneath the lurid glow,
Fall of empires, old and new,
Sublimely mirrored in celluloid hue.
